body.p:
Bradfordville Marion County Ky. Nov. 25th 1862
To his Excellency James F. Robinson
Governor of the State of Kentucky

We the undersigned petitioners would most respectfully state to your excellency that the citizens of this district are labouring under a good deal of inconvenience, and justice is being delayed in consequence of the office of Justice of the peace being vacated. John D. Belden Esqr. the former incumbent has joined the Union army and left the district, there is a good deal of unsettled business lying in the office and no one seems willing to undertake the settlement of it, since Esquire Belden left a fire broke out in our little village which consumed near half the Town, and among other things all the Statue Laws acts of the Legislature. code of Practice and perhaps some of the papers belonging to the office, his record book we understand was saved.

We your petitioners would most respectfully recommend Elijah Webb, (one of our citizens) as a suitable person to fill said office untill the next regular election, we have been acquainted with him for several years his loyalty is unquestionable and we know of no one in the district more competent to discharge the duties of the office. We therefore most respectfully request that you appoint and commission him to fill said office. being District No 1.

Thomas Averitt
E. A. Coppage
R. Y. Thomas
William Averitt
A. L. Bradford
W T Purely
John Averitt
J. W. Coppage
E W Philipps
F. H. Guthrie
John Averitt
M. M. Beard
John H. Tucker
Hardin Youwell
Jas S. Guthrie
F. G. Philips
H. W. Bradford
Elisha Isaacs Sr
Elisha Isaacs Jr.
Mr. Tate please issue & send comm according to pettn

Marion Co
J P
Dist No 2.
Appd Made Nov 29 1862
